docs.lead_paragraph: FOR 16 years state law has allowed doctors to prescribe marijuana for the treatment of glaucoma or the side effects of chemotherapy. Legislators are now also considering allowing doctors to prescribe marijuana in the course of treating neurological disorders and AIDS. And the bill has been worded so the state can ask the Federal Drug Enforcement Agency to allow ''controlled production'' of the drug.
docs.abstract: Connecticut debates whether doctors should prescribe marijuana as pain reliever for those suffering from wide range of ailments; Legislature's Public Health Committee has approved bill that would give doctors such authority (M)
